intro: Elatostema rigidum, commonly known as the rigid shieldflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and the flowers are borne in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Elatostema rigidum is known for its ability to thrive in humid conditions and is often found in subtropical and tropical regions.
